name: Black Pudding
movement: 20 ft. walking, 20 ft. climbing, 20 ft. swimming
description: The Black Pudding is a massive, formless ooze that flows and slithers through underground caverns and dungeons. Its body consists of a thick, acidic sludge that dissolves anything organic it touches, including flesh, wood, and metal.
memorable: It can split into smaller versions of itself when damaged and dissolves nonmagical weapons and armor upon contact, making it a persistent threat in battle.
goals: It instinctively engulfs and dissolves anything it encounters, consuming whatever it can find in forgotten tunnels or abandoned ruins.
relations: It can be found lurking near other subterranean monsters or within abandoned dungeons.
environment: Underground caverns and dungeons, often in forgotten tunnels or ruins.
strengths: Immune to acid, cold, lightning, and slashing damage; can move through narrow spaces without squeezing; exceptionally resilient against conditions.
weaknesses: Sunlight imposes disadvantage on its attack rolls, which can be a significant tactical disadvantage in outdoor encounters.
attacks: It uses a pseudopod to attack, dealing bludgeoning damage alongside corrosive acid damage, and can degrade the armor of those it hits.
most_powerful_ability: Corrosive Body allows it to deal acid damage to creatures that touch it or attack it in melee, while also degrading their nonmagical weapons and armor.
senses: It has blindsight up to 60 feet, but cannot see beyond that range.
additional_information: Can climb difficult surfaces, including ceilings, without difficulty.
Splits into two smaller puddings when taking lightning or slashing damage if above 10 hit points, increasing its threat level.
Does not require air or sleep, remaining active and ready for encounters without rest.
Can reduce the radius of nearby light sources within 60 feet, creating tactical advantages in dimly lit environments.
Dissolves 2-inch-thick nonmagical wood or metal in one round, showcasing its formidable corrosive capabilities.
